result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Larry Eisner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 1 year, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Larry Eisner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Petition for Early Discharge from Probation - Denied by the Court

Case called @ 2:23 p.m. Defendant Michael Larry Eisner in court with attorney Chadwick James Kaehne.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misdemeanor Possession of THC contrary to Wis State 961.41(3g)(e).  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC. 15TR855 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Kaehne. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 18 mos probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars except in furtherance of employment, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA sample and surcharge. Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 1 year, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.  Appeal rights given.  15TR 855 - $761.50 forfeiture w/ 60 DTP or PP, 6 mo DL rev, OWI Assessment. The court withdraws citation B6018143 - OWI 1st.
Defendant's Written Waiver of Preliminary Hearing

15CF-60 and 15TR-855 - Both Cases Called @ 2:21 PM: Defendant Michael Larry Eisner in court with attorney Chadwick James Kaehne.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Per DA:  Pre-Lim Hrg to be waived today.  Defense files a written waiver.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed.  INFO Stated - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.  P/S scheduled upon defense request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 10:30 am.
from DA Blader Re: Officer Conflict for 7/27/2015 Pre-Lim Hearing - Rescheduling Authorized

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:33 p.m.  Defendant Michael Larry Eisner in court with attorney Amaro Lopez appearing on behalf of attorney Kaehne.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing and requests a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Invocation of Right to Counsel

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

1:05 pm case called. Defendant Michael Larry Eisner in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Michael Larry Eisner in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint stated-confirmed receipt. Bond recommendations.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
